name: Henry Wagner
headline: Software Engineer
about: Computer Science M.S.E./B.S.E. at the University of Michigan (GPA 3.87). Full‑stack engineer with experience in TypeScript/React/Next.js and Kotlin/Spring, shipping reliable, user‑centered products. Interested in scalable systems, data, and thoughtful UX.

honors: Department of Engineering Scholarship of Honor

experience.title: Software Engineer Intern — Customer Information Management Team
bullets: Built dynamic Next.js + TypeScript form with conditional field logic, state-dependent validation, and SAP-integrated submission flow
Reduced manual account intervention by 78% via backend-controlled escalation paths and automated reviewer queue logic
Integrated external D&B and address verification APIs into Kotlin + Spring Boot services; developed custom endpoints to process, prioritize, and expose validation results for frontend consumption
Implemented AWS SES email triggers for system events and integrated LaunchDarkly flags across API and UI layers
Wrote unit/integration tests using Jest and Spring Test; used Datadog monitors and Slack alerts for error tracing in production

experience.title: Software Engineer Intern — Merchant Data and Global Menu Team
bullets: Identified performance issues in a large-scale, customer-facing application and collaborated to determine optimal solutions
Managed and troubleshot test environments to better align with production conditions
Conducted rigorous code review and testing to ensure high code quality before promotion to production
Developed a tool to enable improved code management via an intuitive UI for toggling variables
Built RESTful API endpoints and CLI tools to make product data easier to access and modify

projects.name: Census — Contact & Networking Management Platform
projects.description: Full‑stack web app with Next.js (TypeScript) frontend and Spring Boot REST API backend for managing professional contacts and organizations
bullets: Designed and implemented scalable data models with many-to-many associations and metadata (roles, join dates), with validation schemas and secure authentication (Spring Security + JWTs)
Built reusable, production-quality frontend components and validated API contracts via TDD (JUnit, WebMvc)
Preparing AWS deployment (EC2, RDS, S3) with CI/CD pipelines

projects.name: Machine Learning Forum Classifier
projects.description: Classifier for forum posts achieving 85% accuracy using NLP features (content and length)
bullets: Led data training and fine-tuning to accurately categorize posts, improving UX and navigation

projects.name: Euchre (C++)
projects.description: Object‑oriented Euchre card game with multiple gameplay modes including AI opponent
bullets: Applied modular OOP design and strategic algorithms for competitive gameplay

projects.name: Assembly Language Development Suite
projects.description: Assembler, simulator, linker, and cache simulator to support assembly programming
bullets: Simulated basic single-cycle, multi-cycle, and pipelined processors to deepen understanding of architectures

involvement.name: V1 — Software Startup Club
bullets: Engage with peers to learn about tech entrepreneurship and the software development lifecycle
Network with industry professionals to gain insights into practical engineering methodologies

involvement.name: Michigan Youth Sports Initiative — Volunteer/Mentor
bullets: Organize and support youth sports events, emphasizing community involvement and leadership
